questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Two data center fabrics use VPC data center interconnect. The system MAC value on SW1 is 00:23:04:ee:be:20. Which value must be set to configure the system MAC address?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct. SW1 has a system MAC address of 00:23:04:ee:be:20.
You need to configure the system MAC address for SW3 or SW2 in this vPC environment.
The system MAC address must match for switches in the same vPC domain. ; C and D are not correct because SW2 mac should be the same as SW1 (00:23:04:ee:be:20): B is not correct because because mac address of SW3 must be different than mac address of SW1 or SW2 ; so the right answer is A because the mac address is different than the mac address of SW1 or SW2

Selected Answer: A
System MAC Address
Switch-Specific:
Unique to Each Switch: Each switch in a vPC setup has its own unique system MAC address. This MAC address is specific to that individual switch and is used for internal operations, such as control plane communication and management.
Internal Operations: The system MAC address is used by the switch for various internal processes, including maintaining the MAC address table and handling certain types of control plane traffic. Cannot be D because is complete different MAC address

Selected Answer: A
A is the only option that ensures the two vpc domains have different system MACs.

Answer should be C, in my opinion:
VPC peer of sw1 is sw2 and they have to be the same vendor

Each vPC domain has a unique MAC address that is used as a unique identifier for the specific vPC-related operation. Although the devices use the vPC system MAC addresses only for link-scope operations such as LACP

North-South = 1
East-West = 2
Storage Traffic = 3
Storage Replication = 4
Inter- Data Center (DCI) = 5

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A Cisco data center environment is implemented with vPC. The web server replies using the SVI MAC address as the Layer 2 header instead of the HSRP MAC address on VLAN 23. This behavior causes packet drops on the Cisco Nexus 9000 Series Switches due to the vPC loop prevention mechanism. The requirement is for the vPC feature to allow N9K_1 and N9K_2 to forward traffic between the NAS server and the web server, even if the HSRP’s MAC address is not used on Layer 2 headers for VLAN 23. Which feature must be used to accomplish this goal?

DRAG DROP
-

//IMG//


Refer to the exhibit. An engineer must provision a VXLAN deployment. The OSPF has already been configured as the underlay protocol. All BGP configurations will be performed using the template method. The deployment must meet these requirements:
• The local update source for leaf switches must be loopback1.
• The router ID must be the local loopback IP address.
• The external BGP connections must use a template name.

Drag and drop the configuration snippets from the bottom to complete the configuration.

//IMG//

choices.A:
MDS-A(config)# interface fcip4 -

MDS-A(config-if)# use-profile 8 -
MDS-A(config-if)# peer-info ipaddr 200.200.100.7
choices.B:
N9K-2(config)# interface Eth2 -
N9K-2(config-if)# switchport mode trunk
N9K-2(config-if)# auto qos trust dscp
choices.C:
MDS-B(config)# interface fc3 -
MDS-B(config-if)# switchport trunk mode on
MDS-B(config-if)# switchport trunk allowed vsan 2-5
choices.D:
N9K-1(config)# fcoe fcmap 0e.fc.1d

N9K-1(config)# int vfc 1 -
N9K-1(config-if)# bind interface e1/3

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
You can prevent data corruption due to cross-fabric talk by configuring an FC-Map that identifies the Fibre Channel fabric for this Cisco Nexus device. When the FC-Map is configured, the switch discards the MAC addresses that are not part of the current fabric. ( https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/93x/san_switching/configuration/guide/b-cisco-nexus-9000-nx-os-san-switching-configuration-guide-933/m-n9000-san-s-enabling-feature-fcoe.html )

Selected Answer: B
An interface has to be trunk and qos marking is perserved with Auto qos hence answer is B

Selected Answer: D
fcmap is neeed for segragation
A must be wrong because it is for SPAN sessions. B and C are wrong so it should be D!
I agree with D, also auto-qos command does not exist on MDS 9000 CLI reference guide

Answer is D
Configuring the FC-Map
You can prevent data corruption due to cross-fabric talk by configuring an FC-Map that identifies the Fibre
Channel fabric for this switch. When the FC-Map is configured, the switch discards the MAC addresses that
are not part of the current fabric.

questions.question_text:
An engineer implements an environment with multiple traffic types on a consolidated I/O link between Cisco Nexus 9000 Series Switch and MDS 9000 Series Switch. The configuration must meet these requirements:
• The unified I/O link must support LAN and SAN traffic.
• A single, multipurpose Ethernet transport must be used.
• The configuration must discard MAC addresses that are not part of the current fabric.
• The QoS markings must be preserved.

Which configuration set meets the requirements?
